content.title: Scheme for Grant of Financial Assistance for Administering Road Safety Advocacy and Awards for the Outstanding Work Done in the Field of Road Safety
content.beneficiary: NGOs, Trusts, Cooperative Societies, Academic Institutions
content.details: The scheme aims to stimulate and encourage opportunities for various agencies through participation, in order to create awareness on road safety. It aligns with the objectives of the National Road Safety Policy.
benefits: Financial assistance provided in Milestone wise or Single Stage
Awards for outstanding work in road safety advocacy
eligibility: The Applicant Agency must be an NGO/Trust under the Indian Trusts Act/Cooperative Society under the Societies Registration Act/Firm registered under the Companies Act, 1956/2013 or an Academic Institution recognized by UGC.
The Applicant Agency must provide documentary evidence of undertaking a road safety programme.
Experience in completing at least one road safety or advocacy-related program in the last three years.
The Applicant Agency should not have been blacklisted or debarred by any State/Central Government Entities.
documents_required: Power of Attorney for Lead Member of Consortium
Annual Report and Audited Financial Statements
Self-Declaration affidavit by the Head of the organization
Details on targets for each milestone
Any other relevant documents, if required

faqs.question: What is the objective of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the Scheme is to stimulate and encourage opportunities for various agencies through participation, in order to create awareness on road safety.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing agency of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The Applicant Agency must comply with specific conditions including being an NGO/Trust, providing documentary evidence, and having relevant experience.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance is provided to the Applicant Agency, and awards are given for outstanding work in road safety advocacy.

faqs.question: What is the amount of prize money?
faqs.answer: 1st prize: ₹5 Lakhs + Certificate, 2nd prize: ₹2 Lakhs + Certificate, 3rd prize: ₹1 Lakh + Certificate.

faqs.question: How to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The Applicant Agency must submit the proposal online through the Morth NGO Grant Portal.
